name: Hotel Buca di Bacco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here from 25 April for 5 nights on our honeymoon and we were more than impressed by the service, the location, the food and the people.
reviews.title: Incredible hotel in an incredible position

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is well located on the beach, with great views of Positano. Check-in was pleasant and friendly, and our room was INCREDIBLE - two balconies, one with views over the beach. The room was large by european standards and after a great day in Positano we were thrilled knowing we were returning to such an awesome room.
reviews.title: Paradise in Positano

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was generous and varied, and held on a large patio overlooking the beach. The staff were very friendly and engaging, and over the 5 days they became friends. In the evening the patio is also available for dinner for guests only, with the menu from the Buca di Bacco restaurant, which was excellent as well (we ate there all five nights).
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, great location

reviews.text: We also recommend the cooking class - it was fun and informative and you are able to enjoy the meal you have helped to cook afterwards with a nice glass of wine or two.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay
Clean, comfortable hotel with very accommodating staff
reviews.text: It is rated no 1 on Tripadvisor for a good reason - it is truly excellent. We will certainly stay there again when we are next in Positano.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel in late June 2013. We had room 30, which is a double with a sea view balcony. The view is worth everything they charge, which was considerable, but a lot less than if we had made reservations for July or August. The hotel is small, a showplace of colorful Italian tile.....on the floors, in the bathrooms, in the common rooms, in the restaurant. It is steps from the Beach, and our room had a desk, mini bar, hair dryer, big shower/tub, table and chairs on the balcony (about 12 feet long and 5-6 feet wide) louvered doors so that you could have privacy and still hear the surf, comfortable bed and pillows. But the best part is the view....it overlooks the beach, and the hillside to the right, with the buildings marching down to the pier where the ferries dock. It is centrally located, the staff is very accommodating, the breakfasts are in a common room with access to a patio that overlooks the beach, the selection of breakfast foods is also excellent. And, for a special treat, we scheduled the cooking school....what a fun time. If you have the time, don't miss this treat....you make your dinner and enjoy it with your fellow students and take home a hat, apron and cookbook...to say nothing of the great memories. My only question now....when can I go back?
reviews.title: Picture Postcard Perfect

reviews.text: We had a great stay. his hotel is all about making its guests comfortable. Breakfast buffet was very good. We did not have a chance to have dinner in the hotel, but we heard it was very good. Lorenzo and Roberta were superb and helped us in so many ways explore Positano and choose great places to visit and eat. We only wish we could have stayed longer than the three nights. We can't wait to visit again. We highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Outstanding!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We selected the Hotel Buca di Bacco for our first time in Positano and it did not disappoint. Every aspect of this hotel was fantastic from the views of the sea and beach on our terrace to the great morning breakfast with some of the best homemade cakes we have ever had the chance to enjoy. The staff is all very friendly and goes out of their way to assist with any request. The hotel and rooms are very clean and beautifully decorated. We recommend trying to get a room on the first or second floor of the annex building; rooms 42 to 48 have nice terraces with perfect views of the sea. We had the chance to participate in the cooking class offered by the Buca di Bacco restaurant which was an amazing experience. We not only learned some great cooking tips but we were able to sit down and enjoy one of the best meals of our trip prepared by ourselves that included wine. My only comment about this hotel to be aware of is that they currently do not accept American Express as a method of payment. The hotel needs to do a better job informing customers prior to their arrival that American Express is not accepted. It could be a real issue for an individual that may only carry an American Express card when they go to check out of the hotel.
reviews.title: Best Views in Positano, but they don't take AMEX!?!?

reviews.text: On a family holiday - we had such great meals, fantastic service, tourist advice and comfort. The hotel is gorgeous, central and such a lovely place, beautifully decorated. We boated, beached, lunched, had fab dinners and did the cooking course too - this is a must, what a great experience with Michela. Highly recommended, the hotel is pricey but we thought it did not disappoint. Keep going, its a great luxury family hotel. Thanks for making our stay so memorable - we just loved it.
reviews.title: Very very good!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at Buca di Bacco for two nights at the end of a walking holiday. The staff were very welcoming, the room was nice and we had a beautiful balcony overlookng the beach with lovely views of Positano. On the last night we ate at the restaurant and the food was very good, I would recommend the regional cheeses and the lobster.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After 15 years we were back to Buca di Bacco. Like all important wines, getting older made this hotel really better! Complimenti! The hotel is very well located a few steps from the beach. Rooms with enchanting flowering balconies with a breathtaking view of this lovely city and the sea. We got a room da sogno camera 34, a large room sporting blue and white costiere decor and an awesome view from it's big balcony. Wow !! Superb service done by all concierge staff very efficient and friendly: Bravissimi Roberta, Mario and Lorenzo. Great service at breakfast: nice Salvatore and beautfull and sweet Chanthal made our mornings so nice! At last but not least great houskeeping personnel le signore were always smiling and they have cleaned and made our room nicely and with care. We stayed 8 days and all days were explendid! Thanks all hotel personnel for making our stay in Positano unforgetable...again!
reviews.title: An unforgettable stay... again!!!
Buca di Bacco Hotel
reviews.text: My husband and I have stayed at the Buca di Bacco hotel in Positano twice - once in 2008 and again in 2010. We have been to Venice, Florence, Rome and Taormina and Buca di Bacco is by far our favorite hotel and is in the most magical place on earth - Positano! If you're going to the Amalfi Coast, you must stay there. There is also a great restaurant with the most unbelievably attentive waitstaff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a great value ! The staff is wonderful The Chef on premises (Andrea) is charming and skilled ! Very accommodating. Order the zuppe de peshce. The front desk staff helped us select a few hikes in the surrounding mountains.
reviews.title: Fantastic staff, facility and location

reviews.text: We stayed in a sweet suite and felt very lucky. We will absolutely return.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: THe waiters are incredible and the history of the place adds to its charm.
reviews.title: Delightful

reviews.text: My wife and I took our son, his wife and their 3 daughters and our daughter, her husband and their 3 daughters to Rome and Positano. My wife and I had been to Positano in 2007 and wanted to take our kids and grandkids. When we went in 2007, we stayed in the Sirensuse, which we loved. This time with 6 granddaughters ranging in age from 17 to 8, we wanted to be closer to the Beach. After reviewing hotels on Trip Advisor, we chose Buca de Bacco. We could not have made a better choice. The location is the best in Positano. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are beautiful, with fantastic views of the beach and Med. In fact, when our 17 year old granddaughter walked into her room, she immediately photographed it and put it up on facebook with the caption, "I'm in paradise!" In addition, an extensive morning breakfast is served outside
reviews.title: Fabulous Family Hotel Close to Beach in Positano

reviews.text: on a large balcony overlooking the beach and Med. One further point, the hotel is spotless.
reviews.title: Nice location friendly staff

reviews.text: One more tip, after eating out for 4 nights at expensive restaurants, our kids started bringing in pizzas, deli foods, wine and drinks for dinner, which we all ate on our daughters large balcony.
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Superb location especially if coming into positano by boat. Staff friendly and breakfast is quite decent compared to some other places we stayed in Italy. Checking out I used Amex to settle the bill, only for reception staff to realize they no longer have some agreement with them and had to wait for them to "cancel" the charges - will need to check my statement and confirm, but had to reluctantly use another debit card. How can a hotel of their size not accept Amex? Especially with so many US tourists in the town?
reviews.title: Great Italian Getaway
Excellent service!
reviews.text: The level of service we experienced was second to none. The location of the hotel was fantastic - facing the beach. We chose a sea facing room - amazing views. Not cheap but a perfect place to immerse yourself in the Positano experience!

description: . Hotel Buca di Bacco is located in the heart of Positano in prime sea front position on the beach of Marina Grande, it is the ideal spot to experience the magical atmosphere of the place. It is an historical Hotel and Restaurant and dates back approximately to the 1920, today it looks very different from how it did at the beginning of the century. The hotel, which owes its origins to the old tavern is constantly keeping up with the changing times, the classic and plain decor was designed to offer a comfortable and pleasant atmosphere, the rooms have a sea view with either a small balcony or terrace, or a little garden. Among our services, Cooking Classes are available in our Restaurant and offers the opportunity to learn our regional cooking style. Once inside the hotel, the welcoming ambience will allow you to relax and unwind as the eager yet courteous hotel staff aim to please even the most demanding of customers.
